statement: D. Airplane Arrangementstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThere is an airplane which hasnrows from front to back. There is an airplane with $n$ rows of seats.  $m$ people need to board the plane. Each person has a assigned seat number.  People can enter the plane through the front or back doors.  

When a person boards, they go directly to their assigned seat. If the seat is taken, they keep walking in the direction they entered until they find an empty seat. If they reach the end of the row without finding a seat, they are unhappy.

Find the number of ways to assign seats and have everyone board the plane without anyone being unhappy.  Two ways are different if a person chooses a different entrance or has a different assigned seat.  The answer should be the number of ways modulo $10^9 + 7$.

You have a plane with a set number of seats.  A set number of people need to board the plane. Each person has a designated seat. People can enter from either end of the plane.  If a person's seat is taken, they must walk to the end of the row in the direction they entered and find the first empty seat.  Find the number of ways to assign seats and have everyone board successfully without anyone getting stuck.
